item.title: [GRA7][Public Cloud] Upgrade to Stein
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 19, 19:00 UTC  -  Apr 20, 01:00 UTC

Apr 6, 10:03 UTC
Update - We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.

Mar 14, 08:38 UTC
Update - Due to an imponderable we postpone the upgrade operation to Stein for 19/04 from 19h00 UTC to 01h00 UTC

Feb 2, 18:46 UTC
Scheduled - A maintenance operation is scheduled for the GRA7 region on April 05, 2022, between 19:00 and 01:00 (UTC). No disruption is expected on your instances. Some APIs will remain unreachable during the operation.

The API endpoints that will be maintained are the following:
https://compute.gra7.cloud.ovh.net
https://network.compute.gra7.cloud.ovh.net
https://volume.compute.gra7.cloud.ovh.net
https://image.compute.gra7.cloud.ovh.net
https://workflow.gra7.cloud.ovh.net
https://orchestration.gra7.cloud.ovh.net

The other regions will remain accessible by API and via your OVH manager.
This operation allows us to prepare for the future. Thanks to this OpenStack upgrade, we will be able to continue to improve our Public Cloud offering by providing you with new features in the coming months.
The API calls you are used to using will not change, this new version is backwards compatible with the old one.
The target versions of the OpenStack components in this region will be:
Glance : 18 (Stein) ;
Cinder : 14 (Stein) ;
Nova : 19 (Stein) ;
Neutron : 14 (Stein) ;
Heat : 12 (Stein) ;

The components not affected by this operation are :
Keystone : 11 (Ocata) ;
Swift : 2.25 (Ussuri) ;
Horizon : 13 (Queens) ;
Mistral : 7 (Rocky) ;

This update is an important step in the development of the product. Other regions will be concerned by equivalent developments in the coming weeks. To know the detail of the new functionalities, go to https://releases.openstack.org/stein/highlights.html
Compute (Nova) https://docs.openstack.org/nova/stein/reference/api-microversion-history.html#maximum-in-newton
Network (Neutron) https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron/stein.html
Volume (Cinder) https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html#maximum-in-newton
If you want to test the behavior of the updated software versions you can use the GRA9 and SBG7 regions which already expose the target versions.

item.title: [GRA7][Compute] Nova API
item.description:
Apr 7, 21:47 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Apr 7, 21:15 UTC
Investigating - We are experiencing API errors on GRA7 region, ou may encounter error when spawning instances.

item.title: [SYD1][DNS][Public network] -Failure access to services due to update configuration on network devices
item.description:
Apr 7, 20:59 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 07/04/2022 17:53 UTC
End Time : 07/04/2022 18:52 UTC
Service impact : Following an error occurred during this maintenance Incident link: we encounted various services failure like :
- Failed to apply catalog:
- Failed to open TCP connection to eu.api.ovh.com:443 (getaddrinfo: Name or service not known). Our team has performed a rollback that allowed the restoration of all services. All services are now operational again. We apologize for the inconvenience.

item.title: [UK1][Public Cloud] - Upgrade Open vSwitch
item.description:
Apr 7, 09:32 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Apr 7, 08:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Apr 1, 10:40 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 07/04/2022 08:00 UTC
End time : 07/04/2022 10:00 UTC
Service impact : You may experience some ping loss (less than 5 seconds) during this upgrade.
Service improvement : We will upgrade a core network component (openvswitch) on UK1 OpenStack region.

item.title: [BHS][Object Storage] - Unstable service
item.description:
Apr 6, 11:06 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 06/04/2022 10:54 UTC
End Time : 06/04/2022 11:06 UTC
Service impact : We have observed instability on the Object Storage service between 10:54 and 11:06 UTC related to the following incident: https://bare-metal-servers.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/xkd2ty0yvh2x

item.title: OVHCloud Status Public Cloud redesign
item.description:
Apr 6, 11:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Mar 24, 10:34 UTC
Update - Scheduled maintenance is still in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 23, 14:31 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 23, 14:25 UTC
Scheduled - In order to improve the use of OVHStatus Public Cloud, we will redesign this space. The headings and products will correspond to the information and categories available in your manager.
We will proceed to this operation on Wednesday, April 06, 2022 from 10:00 UTC to 11:00 UTC.
All notification subscriptions will be reset to zero.
You will need to re-subscribe in order to receive product notifications.
Thank you for your understanding

item.title: [GRA1][Public Cloud] Upgrade to Stein
item.description:
Apr 4, 13:20 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Mar 29, 19:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 15, 08:28 UTC
Scheduled - A maintenance operation is scheduled for the GRA1 region on March 29, 2022, between 19:00 and 01:00 (UTC). No disruption is expected on your instances. Some APIs will remain unreachable during the operation.

The API endpoints that will be maintained are the following:
https://compute.gra1.cloud.ovh.net
https://network.compute.gra1.cloud.ovh.net
https://volume.compute.gra1.cloud.ovh.net
https://image.compute.gra1.cloud.ovh.net
https://workflow.gra1.cloud.ovh.net
https://orchestration.gra1.cloud.ovh.net

The other regions will remain accessible by API and via your OVH manager.
This operation allows us to prepare for the future. Thanks to this OpenStack upgrade, we will be able to continue to improve our Public Cloud offering by providing you with new features in the coming months.
The API calls you are used to using will not change, this new version is backwards compatible with the old one.
The target versions of the OpenStack components in this region will be:
Glance : 18 (Stein) ;
Cinder : 14 (Stein) ;
Nova : 19 (Stein) ;
Neutron : 14 (Stein) ;
Heat : 12 (Stein) ;

The components not affected by this operation are :
Keystone : 11 (Ocata) ;
Swift : 2.25 (Ussuri) ;
Horizon : 13 (Queens) ;
Mistral : 7 (Rocky) ;

This update is an important step in the development of the product. Other regions will be concerned by equivalent developments in the coming weeks. To know the detail of the new functionalities, go to https://releases.openstack.org/stein/highlights.html
Compute (Nova) https://docs.openstack.org/nova/stein/reference/api-microversion-history.html#maximum-in-newton
Network (Neutron) https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron/stein.html
Volume (Cinder) https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html#maximum-in-newton
If you want to test the behavior of the updated software versions you can use the GRA9 and SBG7 regions which already expose the target versions.
